text: Jason: Okay.

Okay, then Alien Girl
comes over here.
The blocking is right.

We need to make sure the
audience sees her with this...

He rewrote
the entire last act.

Do you think
it was because of me?

I don't know,
but he definitely

didn't get any sleep
last night.
I feel horrible.

We're all out here
because of me,

and now no one's
going to be able to study.

No. No.
It's not your fault.

Holly, since it's your fault
we're all out here,
we'll start with you.
So now, after your solo,

instead of saving your
Earth-girl best friend

from the climate change
monster,

you lament the fate of
the planet while wishing

for your intergalactic prince
to come save you. And go.
Oh, um...

I give up.
I can't defeat these humans

and their drive
to destroy our planet.

I thought I was strong,
but I am weak.

Oh, please,
intergalactic prince, rescue me,

- for I can't go on.
- Wait, stop. Stop.

Holly,
I brought you all out here

so you could connect
to the planet, the Earth,

the thing Alien Girl
is so desperate to save,

- and instead you give me that?
- I'm sorry.

It's just
my first time reading it.

Are we keeping you
from something, Piper?

Well, it's just that
we all have

this really important
math test to study for.
Okay, I'll tell you what.

If Holly nails this
on the next try,
you can all go home.
Holly, go.

I give up.
I can't defeat these humans

and their drive
to destroy our planet.

Well, so much for that.
Even worse than last time.

Look, since
I'm the one struggling,

what if I stay
and everyone else can go?

Absolutely not.
Do it again.

I give up.
I can't defeat these humans

and their drive
to destroy our planet.
Are you doing this on purpose?

Or do you just not understand
the emotional gravity

- of this moment?
- No, no. I do. Absolutely.

Then what? Do you have
an issue with the revisions?

No. No, not at all.
It's just--
What? What? Spit it out!

In the last version,
Alien Girl rescued herself

and her best friend,
and now she's--

Okay, wait, wait.
Don't tell me.

There's some sort of
feminist agenda at play here.

I was just surprised
given how empowering
your last show was.

I can't tell
if you're arrogant
or just plain stupid,

but if I pulled this nonsense
on the set of "Hunter's Point,"
I wouldn't have lasted a day.

- A day!
- I'm really sorry.

Go home, everyone.
I'm finished here.

- ( whimpers )
- Are you okay?

I shouldn't have said anything.
I need to go apologize.
I honestly don't know.

Maybe he's hard on you
because he's trying

to get the best
performance he can.
What do I do?

I guess you go home
and practice

after you study
for the math test.
